section.title: Quick usage
section.para: Run the application with the connection name created at the configuration step as argument.

Create a new query definition by clicking on the add report button (+). Edit the title, the output file name and the description from the Query List tab. Also edit the SQL query statement from the SQL Query tab. Click the Save toolbar button and them click Run to export the data from the table in the format currently selected.

section.title: Interface description
section.para: The application's graphical user interface frame consists of a menu, a toolbar, a statusbar and a notebook with four tabs:

listitem.para: List of queries and details about the selected one.
In the current implementation, up to five parameters ca be used in the SQL query.
Basic SQL viewer/editor with syntax highlighting.
Log for the current activity. Coding inspired from the X.org server: II for info, WW for warning and EE for errors.
Enter edit mode. In this mode the data can be edited and then saved with the Save button.
Save the data from the controls and enter select mode.
Add new report (.qdf file) to the repository. It's created from template.
Remove a report (.qdf file) from the repository. Makes a backup with the .orig extension.
Select the output format. Currently supported formats are: Excel, CSV, Calc and ODF.
Execute the curent query. Output file is created in the configured directory (the default is the current directory).
